text: John Blundell (9 October 1952 – 22 July 2014) was a British economist. He was the Director General and Ralph Harris Fellow at the Institute of Economic Affairs.Institute of Economic Affairs official website. Blundell had been involved in the creation and development of many free-market think tanks. Many people thank Blundell for creating the Thatcher revolution. Blundell died on 22 July 2014 at the age of 61. ==References== ==Other websites== * Video collection from NewMedia Universidad Francisco Marroquín Category:1952 births Category:2014 deaths Category:British economists Category:People from Cheshire
title: John Blundell (economist)
